iaik.security.cipher

Class VarLengthKeyGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.crypto.KeyGeneratorSpi
      • iaik.security.cipher.VarLengthKeyGenerator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AES192KeyGenerator, AES256KeyGenerator, AESKeyGenerator, ARCFOURKeyGenerator, BlowfishKeyGenerator, Camellia192KeyGenerator, Camellia256KeyGenerator, CamelliaKeyGenerator, CAST128KeyGenerator, DESKeyGenerator, GOSTKeyGenerator, HMacGOSTKeyGenerator, HMacMd5KeyGenerator, HMacRipeMd128KeyGenerator, HMacRipeMd160KeyGenerator, HMacSha224KeyGenerator, HMacSha256KeyGenerator, HMacSha384KeyGenerator, HMacSha512KeyGenerator, HMacShaKeyGenerator, HMacWhirlpoolKeyGenerator, IDEAKeyGenerator, MARSKeyGenerator, RC2KeyGenerator, RC5KeyGenerator, RC6KeyGenerator, RijndaelKeyGenerator, SerpentKeyGenerator, TripleDESKeyGenerator, TwofishKeyGenerator

    public abstract class VarLengthKeyGenerator
extends javax.crypto.KeyGeneratorSpi
    This class provides the functionality of KeyGenerator for generating keys with variable length. It is an abstract class that is used by a number of different keygenerators.

    An application uses e.g. 

     KeyGenerator key_gen = KeyGenerator.getInstance("Blowfish");
    to create a KeyGenerator object for the given algorithm. For actually generating the requested secret key from the KeyGenerator object just created, an application calls the generateKey method after having initialized the generator with some random seed or relied on the default system-provided source of randomness: 

     SecretKey new_key = key_gen.generateKey();

    Version:
    File Revision 19
    See Also:
    KeyGenerator, KeyGeneratorSpi, SecretKey, SecretKey

        protected VarLengthKeyGenerator(java.lang.String algorithmName,
                     int minLength,
                     int maxLength,
                     int defaultLength)
        Creates a new KeyGanerator with given minimum, maximum, and default key length. Only internally used.
        Parameters:
        algorithmName - the name of the algorithm
        minLength - the minimum key length
        maxLength - the maximum key length
        defaultLength - the default key length

        protected void engineInit(java.security.spec.AlgorithmParameterSpec params,
              java.security.SecureRandom random)
                   throws java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Initializes this key generator with the given random seed. Parameters are not required. The strength defaults to the default length.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        params - not required
        random - the random seed
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if parameters are supplied

      • engineInit

        protected void engineInit(int strength,
              java.security.SecureRandom random)
        Initializes this key generator for the given strength with the given random seed.
        Specified by:
        engineInit in class javax.crypto.KeyGeneratorSpi
        Parameters:
        strength - the strength of the key to be created; if -1, the default length is used
        random - the random seed
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidParameterException - if the supplied key strength is shorter than the minimum required length or longer than the maximum required length

      • engineInit
